scene_type_descriptions.setup: Introduce characters, setting, and the initial situation.
scene_type_descriptions.conflict: Escalate problems and obstacles leading to a turning point.
scene_type_descriptions.resolution: Resolve the main conflict and show the new status quo.

kishotenketsu.overview: Twist/punchline pattern (meaning flips at the end)

scene_type_descriptions.ki: Introduce the situation and characters without strong conflict.
scene_type_descriptions.sho: Develop the situation and deepen relationships or context.
scene_type_descriptions.ten: Introduce an unexpected twist that re-frames earlier scenes.
scene_type_descriptions.ketsu: Conclude by revealing the new meaning after the twist.

scene_type_descriptions.home_start: Show the ordinary world before the journey begins.
scene_type_descriptions.away: Depict the journey into a different place, state, or situation.
scene_type_descriptions.change: Show events that transform the character or situation.
scene_type_descriptions.home_end: Return to the starting point, highlighting what has changed.

scene_type_descriptions.problem: Define the main problem or goal that must be solved.
scene_type_descriptions.attempt: Show one or more trials and partial successes or failures.
scene_type_descriptions.result: Reveal the final outcome of the attempts and their consequences.

scene_type_descriptions.intro: Introduce the theme and explain what will be presented.
scene_type_descriptions.entry: Present one catalog item, character, or example at a time.
scene_type_descriptions.outro: Summarise the catalog and restate the overall impression.
